intro: Matthiola incana var. glandulifera, commonly known as the glandular stock, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a biennial or short-lived perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features branched stems covered in glandular hairs, which give it its scientific name. Its flowers are usually pink to purple, arranged in dense, terminal clusters. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders.
